text.__SUMMARY__: Corydoras griseus, the gray corydoras, is a small catfish of the corydoras genus. Its natural range is in the Brazilian Amazon region in small tributary streams.
text.Aquarium care: This fish requires slightly alkaline water of about 25 °C (77 °F) with a sandy bottom and lots of hiding places. It needs regular live food feedings, though it will pick up and eat dried food off the bottom.
text.References:
Exotic Tropical Fishes; by H. Axelrod, C. Emmens, W. Burgess, N. Pronek
fishwise.co.za
Froese, Rainer and Pauly, Daniel, eds. (2011). "Corydoras griseus" in FishBase. December 2011 version.
